physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Significant recurrence of corneal dystrophies was observed. The visual acuity was reported as less than 20/80 for symptomatic recurrences in eyes treated for anterior basement membrane dystrophy (ABMD) and lattice dystrophy.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurrence timing for different conditions varied: band keratopathy at an average of 7.8 months, ABMD at 12.4 months, MCD at 13.5 months, lattice dystrophy at 19.7 months, and granular dystrophy at 23.7 months after phototherapeutic keratectomy (PTK).
